results.title: Project Vlad
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Luke Dunn Gielmuda and Aaron Rogers
results.brief_description: Vlad is a Russian chimpanzee sent up to space as a cosmonaut in the middle of the Cold War. With the end of the stand off between the Soviet Union and the West, Vlad is trapped forever in an endless orbit, a victim of humanity and their history. This deceptively simple animation achingly conveys the alienation, terror and ultimate loneliness of the poor animal doomed to wander the cold metallic surfaces of his space pod. Visually and emotionally powerful.
results.creator_credit_for_label: AFTRS, Luke Dunn Gielmuda and Aaron Rogers

results.title: Project Vlad
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Aaron Rogers and Luke Dunn Gielmuda
results.brief_description: This subtle animation is about the chimpanzee, Vlad, who is sent into space during the Cold War. With the dismantling of the Soviet Union he is doomed to wander space as a silent witness to the cruelty and folly of superpower supremacy.
results.creator_credit_for_label: AFTRS, Aaron Rogers and Luke Dunn Gielmuda

results.title: Project Vlad
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Aaron Rogers and Luke Dunn Gielmuda
results.brief_description:
“Sometime in the early 50S the Soviet Space Agency launched Project Vlad. Details are sketchy, but it was a top secret mission. Shrouded in secrecy, few records were kept and the Project has since been all but forgotten…”
Vlad is a Russian chimpanzee cosmonaut. Sent into orbit as a prelude to manned space flight, his hopes for heroism have long since faded. Vlad is a victim of Cold War politics; a long forgotten anachronism whose fate is to trace an endless and lonely trajectory around the Earth.
Project Vlad was created digitally on a Silicon Graphics O2/Infinite Reality Engine using Maya 1.5 and Flame 5.5 software. It was then transferred to 35mm film using a Solitair Film Recorder.

results.title: Project Vena Cava [game trailer]
results.brief_description: ‘Project Vena Cava’ is an ambitious atmospheric first-person shooter with dark cinematic elements. Its storyline is science fiction themed and is delivered primarily through written documents found throughout the game, as well as a voiceover that accompanies the player throughout. It is similar in style to other sci-fi first-person shooters such as ‘Halo’, ‘Metroid Prime’ and ‘Portal’.

results.title: Project Tinkertoy
results.creator_credit: United States. Dept. of the Navy
results.brief_description: A report on a joint US Navy-National Bureau of Standards project to develop a new system of electronics design and manufacture. this uses the ‘building block’ principle by which resistors, capacitors, tube rockets and other parts of common design are assembled by machines into functional electronic parts.
results.description: A report on a joint US Navy-National Bureau of Standards project to develop a new system of electronics design and manufacture. this uses the ‘building block’ principle by which resistors, capacitors, tube rockets and other parts of common design are assembled by machines into functional electronic parts.

results.title: Project the right image
results.brief_description:
English production, NOT made by the Department of Agriculture.

Details hot to and how not to project a 16mm film using a social church gathering as the backdrop. Stars a bumbling projectionist and a priest who first do everything the wrong way and then do everything the correct way.

Comical (in a daggy way) throughout with good use of slapstick humour. Also contains an amusing, very dry voiceover.

results.title: Project out of school: planning a quality service
results.creator_credit: Video Media Production, Maryla Juchnowski, Suzanne Cecil-Fizdale and Alex Jaye
results.brief_description: Provides the considerations for planning quality out of school programs both before and after school. Shows a number of active programs, emphasises the advantages of holding such programs, and illustrates ways of involving parents, children and staff. Appropriate for Professional Development and Personal Development (Home Economics) at VCE level

results.title: Project ice shelf
results.brief_description: Surveys the 1964 Australian Antarctic expedition to study the nature of the Antarctic continent and especially the physical processes in the ice shelves.
